Sentencas: A two-dimensional micro/macroscale model is proposed as an efficient numerical framework for simulating intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells (IT-SOFCs).
Titulo: A micro/macroscale model for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells with prescribed fully-developed axial velocity profiles in gas channels

Sentencas: This model employs a comprehensive microscale model that describes the detailed electrochemical reactions in Ni/YSZ cermet anodes and LSWYSZ composite cathodes based on the three-phase boundary length (TPBL).
Titulo: A micro/macroscale model for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells with prescribed fully-developed axial velocity profiles in gas channels

Sentencas: A simplified macroscale model has been combined with the microscale model to consider the heat and mass transport processes in IT-SOFCs with prescribed fully-developed laminar velocity profiles in gas channels.
Titulo: A micro/macroscale model for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells with prescribed fully-developed axial velocity profiles in gas channels

Sentencas: A hydrogen-fed IT-SOFC is simulated at various operating conditions in order to demonstrate the capabilities of the proposed micro/macroscale model.
Titulo: A micro/macroscale model for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells with prescribed fully-developed axial velocity profiles in gas channels

Sentencas: The results elucidate the effects of co- and counter-flow configurations, inlet temperature, and air and fuel flow rates on the performance of the IT-SOFC.
Titulo: A micro/macroscale model for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells with prescribed fully-developed axial velocity profiles in gas channels
